description: Largest prime p==3 (mod 8) such that Q(sqrt(-p)) has class number 2n+1.
comments: Most of these values are only conjectured to be correct.Apr 15 2008: David Broadhurst says: I computed class numbers for prime discriminants with |D| < 10^9, but stopped when the first case with |D| > 5*10^8 was observed. That factor of 2 seems to me to be a reasonable margin of error, when you look at the pattern of what is included.Arno, Robinson, & Wheeler prove a(0)-a(11). - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 25 2013
references: D. Shanks, Review of R. B. Lakein and S. Kuroda, Tables of class numbers h(-p) for fields Q(sqrt(-p)), p <= 465071, Math. Comp., 24 (1970), 491-492.
N. J. A. Sloane, A Handbook of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1973 (includes this sequence).
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: David Broadhurst, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..739 (conjectural; see comment)
Steven Arno, M. L. Robinson, Ferrell S. Wheeler, Imaginary quadratic fields with small odd class number, Acta Arith. 83 (1998), pp. 295-330.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
